title: Chaos and Panic Grip Tehran as Airstrikes Shake City
partialText: Iranians were beginning their workweek as U.S. and Israeli strikes sent people fleeing parts of the capital and parents racing to collect children from schools.

title: What to Know About the U.S. Attacks on Iran
partialText: The United States and Israel launched a major assault, as President Trump called on Iranians to overthrow the government.

title: OpenAI Reaches A.I. Agreement With Defense Dept. After Anthropic Clash
partialText: The deal came hours after President Trump had ordered federal agencies to stop using artificial intelligence technology made by Anthropic, an OpenAI rival.

title: A Tale of Two Seasons at Columbia, and Two Responses to Student Arrests
partialText: When Mahmoud Khalil was detained by immigration agents last year, the university’s response was restrained. It was different with Elmina Aghayeva this week.

title: Taiwan Arms Sale Approved by Congress Is Delayed as Trump Plans Visit to Beijing
partialText: The package worth billions of dollars and endorsed by lawmakers is stalled at the State Department as the U.S. and China plan an April summit.

title: Pentagon Watchdog Stalls Proposal to Review Targeting in Trump’s Boat Strikes
partialText: A new inspector general delayed a decision on whether to approve the project and is said to have raised its potential political ramifications, in a test of the watchdog system in President Trump’s second term.

title: The Bloody Rise and Fall of Mexico’s Top Crime Boss
partialText: El Mencho’s brutality and business acumen put him atop the cartel world, until he made a fatal mistake.

title: How The Times Covers Cartels and Other Criminal Enterprises
partialText: Cultivating sources. Verifying claims. Staying safe. After the death of El Mencho, four journalists share their approach to this difficult, dangerous work.

title: Abrupt Change for Warner Bros. Prompts Many Grim Faces
partialText: Employees at the company had started to warm to the idea of Netflix as its corporate owner. Now they face the prospect of major cuts under Paramount.

title: Netflix Lost Warner. Maybe That’s a Good Thing.
partialText: It is entirely possible, analysts say, that Netflix will be better off by bailing from its $83 billion deal with Warner Bros. Discovery.

title: Why Have You Started This War, Mr. President?
partialText: Donald Trump promised voters that he would end wars, not start them.

title: The President of War
partialText: The U.S. military was once a tool of last resort for American presidents.

title: The United States and Israel Attack Iran
partialText: The country is retaliating, and the Middle East is in crisis.

title: Berkshire Hathaway Posts a Drop in Earnings in Buffett’s Last Year
partialText: In his first report as C.E.O., Gregory Abel, stuck to a straight commentary rather than Warren Buffett’s folksy tone. The lower earnings were largely driven by declines in the insurance business.

title: Fighting Wildfires Could Soon Get Harder
partialText: Simultaneous emergencies in different parts of the world could stop countries from sharing ground crews and equipment, new research warns.

title: Lloyd Blankfein on Trump, Epstein and Life After Goldman Sachs
partialText: In a wide-ranging interview with Andrew Ross Sorkin, Goldman’s former C.E.O. discussed his life and new memoir.
